Constructors

ScrollContainer(Direction)

Creates a scroll container.

protected ScrollContainer(Direction scrollDirection = Direction.Vertical)

Parameters

scrollDirection Direction

The direction in which should be scrolled. Can be vertical or horizontal. Default is vertical.

Fields

ClampExtension

This limits how far out of clamping bounds we allow the target position to be at most. Effectively, larger values result in bouncier behavior as the scroll boundaries are approached with high velocity.

public float ClampExtension

Field Value

float

DistanceDecayDrag

Controls the rate with which the target position is approached after ending a drag. Default is 0.0035.

public double DistanceDecayDrag

Field Value

double

DistanceDecayJump

Controls the rate with which the target position is approached after jumping to a specific location. Default is 0.01.

public double DistanceDecayJump

Field Value

double

DistanceDecayScroll

Controls the rate with which the target position is approached after scrolling. Default is 0.01

public double DistanceDecayScroll

Field Value

double

ScrollDistance

Controls the distance scrolled per unit of mouse scroll.

public float ScrollDistance

Field Value

float

Scrollbar 

protected readonly ScrollContainer<T>.ScrollbarContainer Scrollbar

Field Value

ScrollContainer<T>.ScrollbarContainer

Properties

AvailableContent

Size of available content (i.e. everything that can be scrolled to) in the scroll direction.

public float AvailableContent { get; }

Property Value

float

Content

The content of this container. Children and all methods that mutate Children (e.g. Add(T) and Remove(T, bool)) are forwarded to the content. By default a container's content is itself, in which case Children refers to InternalChildren. This property is useful for containers that require internal children that should not be exposed to the outside world, e.g. ScrollContainer<T>.

protected override Container<T> Content { get; }

Property Value

Container<T>

Current

The current scroll position.

public float Current { get; }

Property Value

float

DisplayableContent

Size of the viewport in the scroll direction.

public float DisplayableContent { get; }

Property Value

float

DragBlocksClick

Whether clicks should be blocked when this drawable is in a dragged state.

public override bool DragBlocksClick { get; }

Property Value

bool

Remarks

This is queried when a click is to be actuated.

bool

ScrollContent

The container holding all children which are getting scrolled around.

public Container<T> ScrollContent { get; }

ScrollDim

The direction in which scrolling is supported, converted to an int for array index lookups.

int

ScrollDirection

The direction in which scrolling is supported.

public Direction ScrollDirection { get; }

Direction

ScrollableExtent

The maximum distance that can be scrolled in the scroll direction.

public float ScrollableExtent { get; }

Property Value

float

ScrollbarAnchor

Determines whether the scroll dragger appears on the left side. If not, then it always appears on the right side.

public Anchor ScrollbarAnchor { get; set; }

Property Value

Anchor

ScrollbarMovementExtent

The maximum distance that the scrollbar can move in the scroll direction.

public float ScrollbarMovementExtent { get; }

Property Value

float

ScrollbarOverlapsContent

Whether the scrollbar overlaps the content or resides in its own padded space.

public bool ScrollbarOverlapsContent { get; set; }

Property Value

bool

ScrollbarVisible

Whether the scrollbar is visible.

public bool ScrollbarVisible { get; set; }

Property Value

bool

Target

The target scroll position which is exponentially approached by current via a rate of distance decay.

public float Target { get; }

Property Value

float

Remarks

When not animating scroll position, this will always be equal to Current.

OnDrag(DragEvent)

An event that occurs every time the mouse moves while dragging this Drawable.

protected override void OnDrag(DragEvent e)

Parameters

e DragEvent

The DragEvent containing information about the input event.

Remarks

This will only be invoked on the Drawable that returned 

true
from a previous OnDragStart(DragStartEvent) invocation.

OnDragEnd(DragEndEvent)

An event that occurs when the mouse stops dragging this Drawable.

protected override void OnDragEnd(DragEndEvent e)

Parameters

e DragEndEvent

The DragEndEvent containing information about the input event.

Remarks

This will only be invoked on the Drawable that returned 

true
from a previous OnDragStart(DragStartEvent) invocation.

OnDragStart(DragStartEvent)

An event that occurs when the mouse starts dragging on this Drawable.

protected override bool OnDragStart(DragStartEvent e)

Parameters

e DragStartEvent

The DragEvent containing information about the input event.

Returns

bool

Whether to block the event from propagating to other Drawables in the hierarchy.

OnKeyDown(KeyDownEvent)

An event that occurs when a osuTK.Input.Key is pressed.

protected override bool OnKeyDown(KeyDownEvent e)

Parameters

e KeyDownEvent

The KeyDownEvent containing information about the input event.

Returns

bool

Whether to block the event from propagating to other Drawables in the hierarchy.

Remarks

Repeat events can only be invoked on the Drawables that received a previous non-repeat OnKeyDown(KeyDownEvent) invocation which are still present in the input queue (via BuildNonPositionalInputQueue(List<Drawable>, bool)) when the repeat occurs.

An event that occurs when a osuTK.Input.MouseButton is pressed on this Drawable.

protected override bool OnMouseDown(MouseDownEvent e)

Parameters

e MouseDownEvent

The MouseDownEvent containing information about the input event.

Returns

bool

Whether to block the event from propagating to other Drawables in the hierarchy.

Triggered when an action is pressed.

public bool OnPressed(KeyBindingPressEvent<PlatformAction> e)

Parameters

e KeyBindingPressEvent<PlatformAction>

The event containing information about the pressed action.

Returns

bool

True if this Drawable handled the event. If false, then the event is propagated up the scene graph to the next eligible Drawable.

OnUserScroll(float, bool, double?)

Handle a scroll to an absolute position from a user input.

protected virtual void OnUserScroll(float value, bool animated = true, double? distanceDecay = null)

Parameters

value float

The position to scroll to.

animated bool

Whether to animate the movement.

distanceDecay double?

Controls the rate with which the target position is approached after jumping to a specific location. Default is DistanceDecayJump.

UpdateAfterChildren()

An opportunity to update state once-per-frame after Update() has been called for all InternalChildren. This is invoked prior to any autosize calculations of this CompositeDrawable.

protected override void UpdateAfterChildren()
